jcr:content.jcr:title: Committee on Climate Change Science and Technology Integration

contentheadline.headline: Committee on Climate Change Science and Technology Integration

contentrichtext.text: The '''Committee on Climate Change Science and Technology Integration''' was created as part of the [[Clear Skies Initiative]] in February 2002 by [[George W. Bush]], as a Cabinet-level effort to coordinate [[climate change]] science and technology research. The [[White House]] says:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://georgewbush-whitehouse.archives.gov/news/releases/2002/02/20020214.html |title=Fact Sheet: President Bush Announces Clear Skies & Global Climate Change Initiative |accessdate=20 November 2008 |publisher=[[Executive Office of the President of the United States]] |date=February 2002 }}</ref> :"The [[United States Secretary of Commerce|Secretary of Commerce]] and [[United States Secretary of Energy|Secretary of Energy]] will lead the effort, in close coordination with the President's [[Science Advisor]]. The research effort will continue to be coordinated through the [[National Science and Technology Council]] in accordance with the [[Global Change Research Act]] of 1990." ==References== {{reflist}} {{Environment-stub}} [[Category:Climate change organizations]]
